adjectives.description: incruental (comparative more incruental, superlative most incruental)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Bloodless; characterized by no blood loss or very little bleeding.
examples: The herbal treatment served as an incruental alternative to surgery.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Characterized by very little or no bloodshed.
(obsolete) Characteristic of a small, living sacrifice.
examples: How incruental an act for him, to simply drop a quarter in the poor woman's cup each morning.
